text: Patissa monostidzalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1919. It is found in Nigeria. The wingspan is about 20 mm. The forewings are silvery white with a small black spot at the lower angle of the cell. The hindwings are silvery white.Annals and Magazine of Natural History (9) 4 (23): 318 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1919 Category:Schoenobiinae
title: Patissa monostidzalis
